WRITING.TITLE: Older redditors: If you could go back to college and start over again, what major would you pick and why?

WRITING.TEXT: Just about anything ending in -ology.

Teaching as we know it. The future (like it or not) is online learning. Younger students will probably keep the traditional model for a long time, but middle school and up will be online with a few adults in the room who will be more like tutors than what we think of as teachers.

WRITING.TEXT: That's what I haven't been able to understand. Perhaps it has already been addressed here or in a ELI5 post, but how does a man who supposedly most of the party hates get this far into the nominating process? Apparently he has lots of support somewhere, both with votes and with money. But if he is so vile, how did those votes and that financial support happen?
